symptoms.name: Joint pain
symptoms.pattern: Initially in one joint (e.g., hip, knee), then progressing to another (e.g., shoulder)

symptoms.name: Urogenital symptoms
symptoms.pattern: May be absent even in cases of disseminated gonococcal infection

physical_findings: Tenderness to palpation at the affected joint
Intact skin over the affected joint (in some cases)

lab_values.urine_analysis: May show leukocyte esterase and white blood cells
lab_values.synovial_fluid_analysis: Cloudy yellow fluid with elevated white blood cell count, predominantly neutrophils
lab_values.blood_culture: May be positive for Neisseria gonorrhoeae
lab_values.synovial_fluid_culture: May be positive for Neisseria gonorrhoeae

imaging_findings.x_ray: May be initially normal, later showing osteolytic lesions
imaging_findings.mri: Shows evidence of osteomyelitis (focal lesion), septic arthritis, joint effusion, and synovial thickening

required: Clinical presentation consistent with gonococcal osteomyelitis (joint pain, fever, decreased range of motion)
Positive culture for Neisseria gonorrhoeae from blood or synovial fluid
supportive: History of gonorrhea or recent sexual contact
